translations.explanation: To move from one place to another place.

translations.text: go; head for; be bound for
translations.explanation: For ships, planes, cars, etc., to travel to or from a specific place.
To move to attend a certain meeting that has a specific purpose.
To move to a certain place with a specific purpose.
To become a member of a certain group or organization.
To transfer to another place to undertake a specific work.
For objects, rights, etc., to belong to someone.
For one's attention or gaze to be drawn to a certain object.
For words, news, etc., to be known or delivered.
To move toward a certain state or situation.
To reach a certain level or degree.
To reach a certain point of time or a place.
For a certain phenomenon or state to be maintained.
To travel through a certain route.
To move to another place to do a certain task.
To head for or lead to a certain place.
To disappear and become invisible.
For a certain task or job to move forward.
For good or harm to be done to someone or something.
For harm to be done to someone's health.
For certain work to require a lot of effort
For lines, wrinkles, scratches, etc., to be formed.
To come to think of or understand a certain thing.
To be applied to a certain object.
For efforts or force to reach a certain object.
For time to pass or flow.
For machines, etc., to work or operate.
To go bad or spoil.
For stains or spots to be easily removed.
To lose one's senses, being shocked or affected by something.
To hear a signal sound indicating connection in communication.
To continue to be in a certain state.
For a person to die.
An auxiliary verb used to indicate the continuation or progress of a motion, state, or change of state in the preceding statement.
An auxiliary verb used to indicate the occasional repetition of an action to the preceding statement.
To collect one's mind, spirit, etc. together.
To straighten one's conduct, posture, etc.
To clear one's throat or adjust one's breath.
To prepare to fight by adjusting a line, organization, etc.
Every now and then while doing something.
To move from the inside to the outside of an area or space.
To move forward.
For objects, etc., to be made and spread across the society.
For something to be revealed or become known through media sources.
For words, facts, rumors, etc., to become known.
To go into action in a new place, area, etc.
To go to work at a certain place.
To go to a place with a purpose.
To attend a meeting, participate in a sports game, or run for a candidate in an election, etc.
To leave or get out of an area, space, or a place that one belonged to.
To do something or maintain a certain attitude.
For a price, weight, etc., to reach a certain extent.
For money, objects, etc., to be given or spent.
For clothes, shoes, socks, etc., to be worn out or torn.
For an object, etc., to be broken or for one's body part to be hurt.
To lose one's consciousness or mind.
To recover from an illness such as a cold, etc.
For the contract of a house, room, etc., on sale to be completed.
For the electricity to be cut off or an electric light to go off.
For an object with a blade to work well.
For an object to be sold well.
To go to do something.
To move from where one lived to another place.
For something to be proceeded to a certain extent.
For a certain period to end as time passes by.
For a certain task or event to end.
To say something without any special meaning.
To not make something a problem.
To go through a place.
To go past the surroundings of an object.
For the wind to stop blowing, or for the rain to stop falling.
For a facial expression, idea, etc., to appear suddenly and then disappear.
To skip something.
To move from the bottom to the top, or from a lower place to a higher one.

translations.text: go up to the capital; go up to Seoul
translations.explanation: To go to the capital city from a provincial area.
To move one's position to a higher organization or department.
To go from the south to the north.
To move from water to land.
(figurative) To die.
For the document, etc., of a sub-organization to be submitted to an upper organization.
To keep going from a certain point to a place that looks rather high.
To go toward a source by going back to the past.
For one's rank, position, etc., to become higher.
For quality, a level, etc., to become higher.
For a numerical value such as temperature, prices, etc., to increase or become higher.
To go against the current of water.
For force, energy, passion, etc., to increase gradually.
For a building, etc., to be constructed.
To go toward a high place.
To go inside from outside.

translations.text: be installed; be laid in place
translations.explanation: For the hardware of utilities such as electricity, water, etc., to be installed.
For a new state or period to start.
For money, effort, resources, etc., to be spent on a certain project.
To be inserted in something.
To be permeated to the inside.
For something to be delivered or owned by another person, organization, etc.
To become a member of a certain group.
To be included in a certain range or to meet a standard.
For certain content to be understood and kept in memory.
For the surface of an object to become sunken.
For a clear phenomenon to disappear.
To get to know a field of study or obtain knowledge, etc.
For clothes, shoes, etc., to fit one's body.
For an object to move in a circle around a point.
For a job or situation to reach a certain state.
For something to be delivered within a certain range and in order.
To do something in an order, one after another.
To function properly.
For money, goods, etc., to be circulated actively.
To be dizzy or giddy enough to lose one's senses.
(honorific) To die.
To go back to where one was before, or to be in such a state again.
For the result or responsibility of something to be given to an individual, group, organization, etc.
To be divided and distributed.
To finish in a certain state.
For the direction to be changed or tilted to one side.
To go the long way.
To move around a location as if to draw a circle, or to pass by a curved path.
To pace around a certain area.
To move from up to down.
To move from a city or central area to a rural area.
To move from the north to the south.
To move a level or grade from up to down.
To descend from or be a descendant of, and continue to exist in the future.
For food to be digested.
For a value, statistical number, temperature, price, etc., to be lowered.
For a musical note to go down.
To walk down from a high place to a lower place.
To carry something from a high place to a lower place.
